summary:
## The Printing Press: A Game-Changer

The printing press, invented around 1440 by Johannes Gutenberg in Germany, revolutionized how books and documents were made. It used movable type and pressure to quickly transfer ink onto paper, replacing slower hand-copying methods.

This invention spread across Europe, making books affordable and accessible to more people. It fueled literacy, challenged authority, and helped shape modern society by spreading ideas and information on a massive scale. Over time, printing technology advanced, leading to faster, more efficient presses.
title: Printing press
